definition: to waste/to spoil/to destroy/to insult grievously

sentences.english: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law
sentences.chinese: 设下假见证说，这个人说话，不住的糟践圣所和律法。

sentences.english: Ahh, the classic case of self-sabotage.
sentences.chinese: 噢，这是自我糟践的典型案例。

sentences.english: They're accusing him of preaching against the temple and the law.
sentences.chinese: 他们指控他糟践了圣所和律法。

sentences.english: I don't want you decadent, emptiness, confusion, botch oneself, hurt others.
sentences.chinese: 我不要你颓废，空虚，迷茫，糟践自己，伤害别人。

sentences.english: Don't decadent, emptiness, confusion, upon yourself, hurt others.
sentences.chinese: 不要颓废，空虚，迷茫，糟践自己，伤害别人。

sentences.english: 13They produced false witnesses, who testified, "This fellow never stops speaking against this holy place and against the law.
sentences.chinese: 设下假见证说，这个人说话，不住的糟践圣所和律法。

definition: to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]
to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
to waste natural resources recklessly/not to know how to use things sparingly
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
lit. heart of wolf and lungs of dog (idiom)/cruel and unscrupulous
erhua variant of 可勁|可劲[ke3 jin4]
in no shape to be seen/unpresentable/beyond recognition
